definitions: organized process of gathering opinions or votes from a group of people
the top part of a person's head
examples: The election poll shows a tight race between candidates
Exit polls predicted the outcome with surprising accuracy
He patted the horse gently on its poll
The vet examined the injury on the cow's poll

definitions: facts about someone's past experiences, education, and family circumstances
the part of a scene or picture that appears behind the main objects
examples: Her educational background includes degrees from two universities
Employers always check the background of potential employees
The mountains create a beautiful background for the photograph
She painted flowers against a dark blue background

definitions: the coldest season of the year between autumn and spring
examples: Bears hibernate during the long winter months
We're planning a winter vacation to the mountains

definitions: the center of interest or main point of attention
the act of directing mental effort towards a specific task
examples: The focus of the meeting was budget planning
Climate change remains the focus of environmental discussions
She needs complete focus to solve these complex equations
Meditation helps improve your mental focus and clarity

definitions: a building or room where goods are sold to customers
a place where things are manufactured or repaired
examples: The flower shop opens at nine every morning
She works at a shop downtown selling vintage clothing
His father owns an auto repair shop nearby
The wood shop has all the tools we need

definitions: a separate part of something larger, especially within an organization
the mathematical process of calculating how many times one number contains another
examples: She works in the marketing division of the company
The army's third division was stationed near the border
Children learn division after mastering multiplication tables
The division of twelve by three equals four

definitions: suggestions or recommendations about what someone should do in a particular situation
examples: My grandmother always gives the best advice about relationships
The lawyer's advice was to settle out of court

definitions: something done or felt in response to a situation or event
a process in which substances interact to form new substances
examples: His immediate reaction was to call for help
The crowd's reaction to the announcement was overwhelmingly positive
The chemical reaction produces heat and carbon dioxide
Mixing these substances causes a violent reaction

definitions: physical damage or harm done to a person's body
examples: The athlete suffered a serious knee injury during practice
Minor injuries were treated at the scene of accident

definitions: a children's game where one player chases others to touch them
computer systems and digital technology used for storing and processing information
examples: The children played it in the playground after lunch
You're it now, so start counting to ten
She works in IT support for a major corporation
The IT department handles all computer-related issues

definitions: a piece of paper that allows entry to an event or travel
an official notice of a traffic violation or fine
examples: We bought tickets for tonight's concert online
Don't forget to bring your train ticket tomorrow
He got a parking ticket for exceeding the time limit
The speeding ticket cost her two hundred dollars

definitions: a mark showing the quality of a student's work
a particular level of quality, size, or importance
examples: She received excellent grades in all her subjects
The teacher posts grades online every Friday
This restaurant serves only grade A beef
Different grades of gasoline have different octane ratings

definitions: the process of a baby leaving its mother's body
the beginning or origin of something
examples: The birth of their first child changed everything
She gave birth to twins last Tuesday morning
The birth of the internet revolutionized global communication
This meeting marks the birth of a new partnership

definitions: a picture created using paint on canvas or other surface
the activity of applying paint to walls or surfaces
examples: The museum acquired a rare painting by Monet
Her paintings capture the beauty of rural landscapes
Painting the house took us three whole weekends
He enjoys painting as a relaxing weekend hobby

definitions: the final result or consequence of an action, situation, or event
examples: The outcome of the election surprised political analysts everywhere
We're still waiting to hear the outcome of negotiations

definitions: a person or group that is actively opposed or hostile to someone
examples: The two countries have been enemies for decades
He made many enemies with his controversial policies

definitions: physical harm that makes something less valuable or useful
money claimed or awarded as compensation for loss or injury
examples: The storm caused extensive damage to coastal properties
Water damage ruined most of the stored documents
The jury awarded damages of five million dollars
She's seeking damages for breach of contract

definitions: a person or thing that exists, especially a living creature
the state or fact of existing
examples: Humans are complex beings with emotions and consciousness
Every living being deserves respect and compassion
The nature of being has puzzled philosophers for centuries
She enjoys the simple being of quiet mornings

definitions: violent weather with strong winds, rain, thunder, or snow
a sudden violent disturbance or upheaval
examples: The storm knocked down power lines across the city
Weather forecasters predict severe storms this weekend
His resignation caused a storm of controversy
The announcement created a storm on social media

definitions: the external form or outline of something
the physical condition or fitness of a person
examples: Children learn to identify basic shapes like circles
The cloud had an unusual shape resembling a dragon
She's in excellent shape after months of training
You need to get in shape before the marathon

definitions: a round, deep dish used for holding food or liquids
a large stadium shaped like a bowl for sports events
examples: She served the soup in ceramic bowls
Mix all the ingredients in a large bowl
The football game will be played at the Rose Bowl
The concert venue was a natural bowl surrounded by hills

definitions: a group of people officially appointed to investigate or manage something
money paid to someone for selling goods or services
examples: The commission will investigate allegations of corruption
She serves on the city planning commission
Real estate agents typically earn a six percent commission
His commission increases with higher sales volumes

definitions: the person in command of a ship or aircraft
the leader of a sports team or military unit
examples: The captain navigated the ship through dangerous waters
Captain Smith has thirty years of sailing experience
She was elected captain of the basketball team
The captain led his troops into battle bravely

definitions: the organ on the side of the head used for hearing
the seed-bearing part of cereal plants like corn or wheat
examples: The doctor examined her ear for signs of infection
Loud music can permanently damage your ears
Each ear of corn has hundreds of individual kernels
The wheat ears were golden and ready for harvest

definitions: soldiers or armed forces, especially in large groups
examples: Additional troops were deployed to secure the border
The general inspected his troops before the mission

definitions: the hard material that forms the trunk and branches of trees
an area of land covered with trees smaller than a forest
examples: The table was made from solid oak wood
Different woods have different hardness and grain patterns
We took a walk through the wood behind the house
The ancient wood is home to many rare species

definitions: a soft, heavy, toxic metallic element used in batteries and radiation shields
the position of being ahead or in front
examples: Old paint often contains dangerous levels of lead
Lead pipes were common in houses built before 1950
She took the lead in organizing the charity event
Their team has a commanding lead in the tournament

definitions: a member of the clergy, especially in Protestant churches
a senior member of government heading a department
examples: The minister delivered an inspiring sermon on Sunday
She studied theology to become a minister
The health minister announced new vaccination policies
Several ministers attended the emergency cabinet meeting

definitions: a person who lives near or next to another person
examples: Our neighbors invited us over for dinner tonight
Good neighbors look out for each other's property

definitions: programs and operating systems used by computers to perform specific tasks
examples: The company develops software for managing hospital records
You need to update your software to fix security issues

definitions: a conclusion or result reached after investigation or research
examples: The study's findings suggest a link between diet and mood
Archaeological findings revealed an ancient civilization

definitions: a man of noble rank or high position in society
God or Jesus Christ in Christian belief
examples: The lord owned vast estates throughout the county
Lord Wellington was a famous British military commander
They prayed to the Lord for guidance and strength
Many hymns praise the Lord for his mercy

definitions: a journey in a car or other vehicle
strong motivation or determination to achieve something
examples: The drive to the coast takes about three hours
We went for a scenic drive through the mountains
Her drive to succeed impressed all her professors
The team showed incredible drive in the final quarter

definitions: the degree of hotness or coldness measured on a definite scale
examples: The temperature dropped below freezing last night
Body temperature above 100 degrees indicates a fever

definitions: an opening or wound made by something sharp
a reduction in amount, size, or number
examples: The deep cut on her hand required several stitches
Be careful not to get a paper cut
The company announced cuts to employee benefits
Budget cuts affected all government departments

definitions: the capacity to have an effect on someone's character, development, or behavior
examples: Parents have enormous influence on their children's values
Social media's influence on teenagers continues to grow

definitions: an established or official way of doing something, especially a series of steps
examples: The surgical procedure takes approximately two hours to complete
Please follow standard safety procedures when operating machinery

definitions: a feeling of deep admiration for someone's abilities or qualities
a particular aspect, point, or detail
examples: Students should show respect for their teachers
She earned everyone's respect through hard work
The two proposals differ in several important respects
In this respect, our findings confirm previous research

definitions: a moving ridge of water on the surface of the sea
a movement of the hand used as a greeting or signal
examples: Huge waves crashed against the rocky shore
Surfers search for the perfect wave
She gave a friendly wave from across the street
The queen's wave delighted the waiting crowds

definitions: beliefs or behaviors passed down within a group from generation to generation
examples: The family tradition of Sunday dinners continues today
Many cultural traditions are preserved through festivals

definitions: a person who performs in plays, movies, or television shows
examples: The actor rehearsed his lines before going on stage
Many famous actors started in small theater productions

definitions: a small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur and retractable claws
examples: The cat curled up on the warm windowsill
Cats are known for their independent nature

definitions: a large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road on fixed routes
examples: The school bus arrives at seven-thirty every morning
Taking the bus is cheaper than driving downtown

definitions: items worn to cover the body including shirts, pants, and dresses
examples: She donated old clothes to the local charity
Winter clothes take up more closet space

definitions: a secret sexual relationship between people not married to each other
an event or sequence of events of a particular kind
examples: The politician's affair destroyed his career
Their affair lasted for several months
The wedding was an elegant affair with 200 guests
Managing finances is a complicated affair

definitions: communication or relationship between people or organizations
the state of physical touching
examples: Please contact us if you have any questions
She lost contact with her college friends
Avoid contact with the hot surface
The infection spreads through direct contact

definitions: a class or division of things regarded as having particular shared characteristics
examples: Products are organized into categories for easier browsing
This film doesn't fit into any traditional category

definitions: a matter dealt with in conversation, writing, or discussion
examples: Climate change was the main topic of discussion
Choose a topic for your research paper carefully

definitions: success in a struggle, war, or competition against an opponent
examples: The team celebrated their victory with champagne
It was a hard-fought victory against tough opponents

definitions: a diagrammatic representation of an area showing physical features, roads, and distances
examples: The hikers studied the map before starting their journey
Modern maps are often digital and interactive
